comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: That video is frickin hilarious (the Penne all'Arrabiata one that Ivy mentioned: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=muaAZE0M3LU ). As far as salting goes, I haven't ever found it to be particularly necessary. People say it removes bitterness but most of the eggplants I get are creamy and sweet, with maybe just a slight but pleasant bitter edge. Certainly nothing objectionable. Maybe folks who think you need to salt it just aren't cooking it thoroughly enough? Although I'll give one caveat... the eggplant parm. recipe I have on the blog, I did salt it the time I made that, because a guest insisted they would hate it otherwise! And I haven't remade it since, so I can't vouch that it would work without salting before frying.
